DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Deviation Performed Observation Outcome Organ System Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A variation from process or procedures defined in a study protocol. EXAMPLE(S): Study subject not withdrawn as per protocol, excluded concomitant medication, treatment deviation. NOTE(S): Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety. A coded value specifying the anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions. EXAMPLE(S): gastrointestinal system, urinary system, hematopoietic system

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Deviation Performed Observation Outcome Organ System Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An unintended departure from the study plan which has not been prospectively reviewed and approved by the IRB and FDA.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unintended departure from the study plan which has not been prospectively reviewed and approved by the IRB and FDA.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. (CDISC Glossary)
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
